scenes.subtitle: Prefix
lines: The other one is similar but for negating \‚ä§\ and \‚ä•\: it's like a little squiggle minus \~\ that just flips true to false and false to true. For example, this little expression evaluates \‚ä§ | ‚ä•\, which is \‚ä§\, then flips the \‚ä§\ to \‚ä•\. This is the same as saying \(‚ä§ | ‚ä•).not()\ but so much more sleek.

scenes.subtitle: Bind
lines: So like, here's a really simple example. Let's say we want to name a number. We just say the name, then :, then the number we want. Simple, right? Now, any time we use the name number in an expression, it will evaluate to \1\. Like here, where we name it, then use its name to give @Program whatever value it has.
